loading module¶

loading.find_closest_pkg(curr_add, truck_id, pkg_id_list, package_hash, location_hash)¶

Warning

THIS METHOD WAS USED IN A PREVIOUS VERSION AND IS NOT CURRENTLY USED. Use find_closest_pkg_dijkstras instead.

Finds the nearest package destination to the current address that is allowed on the specific truck.

Parameters

  • curr_add (str) – the current address

  • truck_id (int) – the id of the current truck

  • pkg_id_list (list[str]) – the package ids currently being loaded

  • package_hash (ChainingHashTable[str, Package]) – the Package objects

  • location_hash (ChainingHashTable[str, Location]) – the Location objects

Returns

the id of the closest package destination, ‘-1’ if none found

Return type

str

loading.find_closest_pkg_dijkstras(curr_add, truck_id, pkg_id_list, g, package_hash)¶

Finds the nearest package destination to the current address that is allowed on the specific truck.

This version uses Dijkstra’s Algorithm.

Parameters

  • curr_add (str) – the current address

  • truck_id (int) – the id of the current truck

  • pkg_id_list (list[str]) – the package ids currently being loaded

  • g (Graph) – the Graph structure that Dijkstra’s Algorithm has been run on

  • package_hash (ChainingHashTable[str, Package]) – the Package objects

Returns

the id of the closest package destination, ‘-1’ if none found

Return type

str

loading.get_last_delayed_package(delayed, package_hash)¶

Gets the delayed package object with the latest delay time.

Parameters

  • delayed (list[str]) – the delayed package ids

  • package_hash (ChainingHashTable[str, Package]) – the Package objects

Returns

the latest delayed package

Return type

Package

loading.get_return_order_of_trucks(truck_list)¶

Gets the list of trucks ordered by the time they return to the hub.

Parameters

truck_list (list[Truck]) – the trucks

Returns

the trucks ordered by time

Return type

list[Truck]

loading.initiate_loading(truck_list, package_lists, package_hash, location_hash)¶

Warning

THIS METHOD WAS USED IN A PREVIOUS VERSION AND IS NOT CURRENTLY USED. Use initiate_loading_dijkstras instead.

Loads the truck with the packages from the package list.

If more than one truck is given, trucks are loaded evenly by iterating over the trucks and loading the next package closest to its previously loaded package. After a package is loaded, the truck is sorted. This helps if there were sibling sets or other package lists loaded onto this truck previously.

Parameters

  • truck_list (list[Truck]) – the trucks to be loaded

  • package_lists (list[str]) – the package ids to be loaded

  • package_hash (ChainingHashTable[str, Package]) – the Package objects

  • location_hash (ChainingHashTable[str, Location]) – the Location objects

Returns

loading.initiate_loading_dijkstras(truck_list, package_lists, g, package_hash)¶

Loads the truck with the packages from the package list.

If more than one truck is given, trucks are loaded evenly by iterating over the trucks and loading the next package closest to its previously loaded package. After a package is loaded, the truck is sorted. This helps if there were sibling sets or other package lists loaded onto this truck previously.

This version uses Dijkstra’s Algorithm.

Parameters

  • truck_list (list[Truck]) – the trucks to be loaded

  • package_lists (list[str]) – the package ids to be loaded

  • g (Graph) – the Graph structure that Dijkstra’s Algorithm has been run on

  • package_hash (ChainingHashTable[str, Package]) – the Package objects

Returns

loading.load_package(truck, pkg_id_list, package_hash, location_hash)¶

Warning

THIS METHOD WAS USED IN A PREVIOUS VERSION AND IS NOT CURRENTLY USED. Use load_package_dijkstras instead.

Loads the next package onto a truck.

Nearest neighbor of the previous package added onto the truck is used to find the next package. If the truck is empty, then the nearest neighbor of the Hub is used.

Parameters

  • truck (Truck) – the truck being loaded

  • pkg_id_list (list[str]) – the list of package ids currently being loaded from

  • package_hash (ChainingHashTable[str, Package]) – the Package objects

  • location_hash (ChainingHashTable[str, Location]) – the Location objects

Returns

True if a package was found to load onto the truck, False if no package was available to be loaded

loading.load_package_dijkstras(truck, pkg_id_list, g, package_hash)¶

Loads the next package onto a truck.

Nearest neighbor of the previous package added onto the truck is used to find the next package. If the truck is empty, then the nearest neighbor of the Hub is used.

This version uses Dijkstra’s Algorithm.

Parameters

  • truck (Truck) – the truck being loaded

  • pkg_id_list (list[str]) – the list of package ids currently being loaded from

  • g (Graph) – the Graph structure that Dijkstra’s Algorithm has been run on

  • package_hash (ChainingHashTable[str, Package]) – the Package objects

Returns

True if a package was found to load onto the truck, False if no package was available to be loaded

loading.load_siblings(truck_list, sibling_sets, package_lists, package_hash)¶

Warning

THIS METHOD WAS USED IN A PREVIOUS VERSION AND IS NOT CURRENTLY USED. Use load_siblings_dijkstras instead.

Loads packages onto the trucks that must be loaded together (sibling packages). Trucks are cycled after loading each sibling set. As siblings are loaded onto the trucks, they are removed from their associated package list.

Parameters

  • truck_list (list[Truck]) – the trucks to be loaded

  • sibling_sets (list[set[str]]) – the sets of package ids that must be loaded together

  • package_lists (list[list[str]]) – the list of package id lists

  • package_hash (ChainingHashTable[str, Package]) – the Package objects

Returns

loading.load_siblings_dijkstras(truck_list, sibling_sets, package_lists, package_hash)¶

Loads packages onto the trucks that must be loaded together (sibling packages). Trucks are cycled after loading each sibling set. As siblings are loaded onto the trucks, they are removed from their associated package list.

This version uses Dijkstra’s Algorithm.

Parameters

  • truck_list (list[Truck]) – the trucks to be loaded

  • sibling_sets (list[set[str]]) – the sets of package ids that must be loaded together

  • package_lists (list[list[str]]) – the list of package id lists

  • package_hash (ChainingHashTable[str, Package]) – the Package objects

Returns

loading.sort_truck(truck, package_hash, location_hash)¶

Warning

THIS METHOD WAS USED IN A PREVIOUS VERSION AND IS NOT CURRENTLY USED. Use sort_truck_dijkstras instead.

Sorts the packages on a truck, starting from the closest to the hub.

Parameters

  • truck (Truck) – the truck being sorted

  • package_hash (ChainingHashTable[str, Package]) – the Package objects

  • location_hash (ChainingHashTable[str, Location]) – the Location objects

Returns

loading.sort_truck_dijkstras(truck, g, package_hash)¶

Sorts the packages on a truck, starting from the closest to the hub.

This version uses Dijkstra’s Algorithm.

Parameters

  • truck (Truck) – the truck being sorted

  • g (Graph) – the Graph structure that Dijkstra’s Algorithm has been run on

  • package_hash (ChainingHashTable[str, Package]) – the Package objects

Returns
